Auckland jewellery store heist: Getaway driver Marcieanne Nimot sentenced over $250,000 robbery https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/crime/getaway-driver-marcieanne-nimot-jailed-for-250k-ellerslie-auckland-jewellery-store-heist/IVCOUWEMCZET3IMJ2WKPV7ACS4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/crime/getaway-driver-marcieanne-nimot-jailed-for-250k-ellerslie-auckland-jewellery-store-heist/IVCOUWEMCZET3IMJ2WKPV7ACS4/ Craig KapitanVideo showed masked teen co-defendants, who were half her age, lash out with hammers. Sat, 11 May 2024 03:00:00 +0000 Two bystanders were injured when they tried to stop four teens accused of participating in a $250,000 jewellery store heist in Ellerslie in November 2022. Marcieanne Nimot, 37, has been sentenced for aiding the theft by serving as the driver of another getaway vehicle. Photo / Jason Knight

How much do I need to save for my golden years? https://www.nzherald.co.nz/business/mary-holm-column-500k-1m-how-much-do-i-need-to-save-for-my-golden-years/7XUDYTRK4BFZBMN4ARSNPPRTHA/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/business/mary-holm-column-500k-1m-how-much-do-i-need-to-save-for-my-golden-years/7XUDYTRK4BFZBMN4ARSNPPRTHA/ Mary HolmOPINION: If the $1m estimate were correct, a big proportion of retirees would struggle. Senior Mongols gang member on the run for 12 months, armed police find loaded shotgun under couch within reach of child https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/senior-mongols-gang-member-on-the-run-for-12-months-armed-police-find-loaded-shotgun-under-couch-within-儿童触及范围/MFCDIGZXGJA5DEZ52LI2BFWLGQ/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/senior-mongols-gang-member-on-the-run-for-12-months-armed-police-find-loaded-shotgun-under-couch-within-儿童触及范围/MFCDIGZXGJA5DEZ52LI2BFWLGQ/ Jared Savage, Katie HarrisName suppression lifted when the gang's 'orchestrating influence' was sentenced. Fri, 10 May 2024 17:03:00 +0000 The Mongols are an international motorcycle gang which established a chapter in New Zealand in 2019. Senior members have been convicted of serious drugs, firearms and violence offences.
Court of Appeal rejects sovereign citizen appeal by Auckland instructor Chris Wiremu, who hit students https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/crime/court-of-appeal-rejects-sovereign-citizen-appeal-by-auckland-instructor-chris-wiremu-who-hit-students/GLG4LJZM7NHA3NJTIE4U5HAQUQ/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/crime/court-of-appeal-rejects-sovereign-citizen-appeal-by-auckland-instructor-chris-wiremu-who-hit-students/GLG4LJZM7NHA3NJTIE4U5HAQUQ/ Craig KapitanHe told the Court of Appeal they had no power over him. The justices disagreed. Sat, 11 May 2024 00:00:00 +0000 Chris Wiremu was instructing primary students in mau rākau, a martial art using Māori weapons, when authorities say he struck eight of the children. File photo / Alex Burton
